citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The Program of Veterinary Care states that the Attending Veterinarian (AV) must be contacted if an animal suddenly or
unexpectedly dies so that the AV can determine if a necropsy is warranted. However, the AV was not contacted after two
recent sudden and/or unexpected animal deaths: a blackbuck was found dead and the AV was only informed after the
animal had been disposed of (so a necropsy could not be performed), and the AV was not informed at all about the death
of a 4-day-old goat kid. The AV was contacted and confirmed that the instructions in the Program of Veterinary Care have
not changed and should be followed by facility personnel. Failure to follow the instructions of the AV may result in animal
health problems or animal deaths due to lack of veterinary oversight. Correct immediately, by 02/28/2023, by following the
AV's instructions, including the instructions written in the Program of Veterinary Care, and by ensuring that the AV has
authority to provide adequate veterinary care and to oversee the adequacy of all other aspects of animal care and use.

Records of were incomplete. Disposition records were missing for at least 1 goat kid, 3 blackbuck, 1 dromedary camel,
and 1 wallaby. Accurate recordkeeping is important for veterinary oversight and animal traceability in the event of disease
outbreaks or stolen animals. Correct by 03/28/23 by maintaining accurate and complete records of acquisition and
disposition in accordance with the Animal Welfare Act.

citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
Records of acquisition were not available for animals on the property with the exception of 3 recently acquired rabbits.
The most current enrichment plan for nonhuman primates could not be located. Access to all required records is required
during USDA inspections so that USDA officials can assess compliance with the Animal Welfare Act (AWA) regulations.
Correct by 03/28/2023 by ensuring that all other required records and documents are available for review during future
USDA inspections.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the safari park manager.
End Section
